meanings.def: a male child or a young male person
examples: a little/small/young boy
I used to play here as a boy.
The older boys at school used to tease him.
Now she's a teenager, she's starting to be interested in boys.
Be a good boy and get me my coat.
Two teenage boys were standing outside the shop.
a twelve-year-old boy
Now you're a big boy you can stay up later.
Eat up your greens—there's a good boy.
They've had a baby boy.
She gave birth to a healthy baby boy.
Oliver is a popular boy's name.
We used to play there when I was a little boy.
They have two boys and a girl.
Her eldest boy is at college.
How old is your eldest boy?
I have three boys.
I've got three boys.
Our youngest boy is just starting school.
Their boy is small for his age.
Her eldest boy has just started high school.

meanings.def: a boy or young man who does a particular job
examples: a delivery boy

meanings.def: a way of talking about somebody who comes from a particular place, etc.
examples: He's a local boy.
a city/country boy

meanings.def: a group of male friends who often go out together
examples: a night out with the boys

meanings.def: a way of talking about your country’s soldiers to show that you like and care about them
examples: a message of support for our boys serving overseas

meanings.def: used as an offensive way of addressing a black man, especially in the past
it is not healthy to spend all your time working; you need to relax too
you should not be surprised when boys or men behave in a noisy or rough way as this is part of typical male behaviour
people use the expression jobs for the boys when they are criticizing the fact that somebody in power has given work to friends or relatives
from when somebody was young to when they were old or older
examples: He's been doing the same job for 50 years—man and boy.

meanings.def: used to express feelings of surprise, pleasure, pain, etc.
examples: Boy, it sure is hot!
Oh boy! That's great!
Boy, it hurts!
Boy, am I glad to see you!
They eat it for breakfast and boy is it good!
